intro: Paepalanthus lundii, commonly known as the white-flowered puya, is a striking plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with numerous white, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. Paepalanthus lundii is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
